Hamesse, Louvain-la-Neuve 1996, p. 51.

author: anon.
contents: list of gods, with their Latin equivalent (in Greek characters).
propernames: Hêrôes katoikidioi (R); Lares familiares; Daimôn (R); Genius; Hêmitheoi (R); Indigetes; Sarapis (R); Serapis; Charôn (R); Orcus; Thanatos (R); Mors; Enypnion (R); Somnium; Paniskos (R + 1); Hygieia (R); Salus; Gê Mêtêr (R); Terra Mater; Hêra; Juno [Junon]; Hêra Basilissa; Juno[n] Regina; Eileithyia; Juno[n] Lucina; Artemis; Diana; Lêtô; Latona; Aphroditê; Venus; Nemesis; Ultrix; Dêmêtêr; Ceres; Phersephonê; [Persephonê]; Proserpina; Hestia; Vestia; Tychê; Fortuna; Semelê; Libera; Isis; Mêtêr Megalê; Mater Magna.
mythological: Hêrôes katoikidioi (R);Lares familiares; Daimôn (R); Genius; Hêmitheoi (R); Indigetes; Sarapis (R); Serapis; Charôn (R); Orcus; Thanatos (R); Mors; Enypnion (R); Somnium; Paniskos (R + 1); Hygieia (R); Salus; Gê Mêtêr (R); Terra Mater; Hêra; Juno [Junon]; Hêra Basilissa; Juno[n] Regina; Eileithyia; Juno[n] Lucina; Artemis; Diana; Lêtô; Latona; Aphroditê; Venus; Nemesis; Ultrix; Dêmêtêr; Ceres; Phersephonê; [Persephonê]; Proserpina; Hestia; Vestia; Tychê; Fortuna; Semelê; Libera; Isis; Mêtêr Megalê; Mater Magna.
statepreservation: 28 lines in two parallel columns, of which the left one is missing in l. 1-14; no name can actually be read in l. 1-3.;palimpsest (traces of former text visible at the bottom).
lectionalsigns: some misspellings; occasionally intrusive iota; two corrections.
hand: medium-sized to large, informal, round, upright, markedly bilinear, somewhat irregular, written in broad letters by a fairly practised hand, usually well separating the letters, with hooks and serifs on many letters and some cursive forms.
